reviews.text:
A very big library very close to Wood Green Station  - actually, a walking distance. Next to lots of amenities, restaurants, superstores, malls etc.
Quiet inside - not disturbed by the outside busy roads.
Very kind, friendly and helpful staff.
Has printing facilities, toilets ðŸš», large lifts and stairways with a paid parking space behind the library. Haringey uses part of the ground floor on week days for its customer service.
Has a youth library and adult learning classes on the second floor.
Has a sizeable computer room, private reading room and a children's library on the first floor.
On the ground floor, it has rows of books in one side, quiet areas to read, side room (Business Lounge) for private event which I've used to host a Women's History Month Talk. The business lounge has computers, white boards, white screen for projectors as can be seen in the pictures. It can fit upto 25 people I believe.
It also has a large space on the ground floor which can be booked for events like exhibitions or launching or talks. I've also used this space for my book signing events as can also be seen in the picture.

Look at the previous reviews and see that:

1) They cannot be asked to respond to any form of criticism or any reviews.

2) Nothing gets done to improve the things people are most concerned with.

3) It is not really fir for purpose.

I concur with the reviews that shine a negative light over this service but it is well deserved. The toilets are horrendous, totally disgusting and unhygienic. The counter service is slow, inadequate and are not really helpful when machines are down or cards don't work  The book selection is abysmal and study books are far and few between. The soft chairs look like they have been brought in from a flood drenched tip that was also neglected for 100 years.

You could save a bit if money, if that is one factor, by getting rid of the security there. I would love a job of sitting on the stool inside the entrance playing in my phone all day. What a great job, getting paid to text your chums and watch YouTube videos.

It's not a great reading environment and noisy people are allowed to be noisy, I suppose it would distract the security from playing on their phone if they really had to sort people out and walk around checking all is well

I use a library in the city now as the local one is not fit for purpose any longer.

The security guard is rude and shouted at me today. He's very strange. I simply asked him if the library was open yet. I get it not everyone's a morning person but have some manners. Also the toilets are very very dirty. Need to fix up. With pee all over the floor.
Although the study area is quiet in comparison to others in haringey. I can actually get work done!

The toilets are of subhuman standards, FIX UP HARINGAY COUNCIL! EVEN THOUGH THEY WORK DOWNSTAIRS NO ONE SEEMS TO ADDRESS THIS.

how are the elderly, disabled or young children able to access these toilets - disabled toilets are locked, female and mens toilets are absolutely disgusting i had to hold in my pee and it puts me off the library

when i sat on the coaches on the ground floor i got a rash, this is how filfthy this place is

its really unfair why are us ethnic minorties getting the worst libraries if this was a highly populated white middle class area the library toilets would be clean!

do the children of harringay not matter? youre not promoting life long learning your just giving us awful places this is dirty if i took a photo today i would want to but im too disgusted to go back to those toilets

WE DESERVE BETTER HARRINGAY

HEAT THE LIBRARY UP, CLEAN THE DTOILETS, RENEW THE BEDBUGGED FURNITURES AND REPLACE IT WITH WOODEN SURFACES SO ITS CLEANER

I would give them more, but i feel like they don't deserve anymore, since when i tried to return my book at the front desk, they refused to talke it, and said i had to use self checkout. But now they have lost the book, and are charging me for the book they lost, because they leave the freshly returned books (easy to access) and right next to the exit. The annoying part of this, is that i returned it, a month ago so i dont even have the recipt cause i didnt realise they were charging me.

address: 187-197A High Rd, London N22 6XD, United Kingdom
